chargeHist.descr: Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm
Knowingly Operating While Revoked (Cause Great Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Delacruz Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Injury, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(2)(a).
  • Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Miscellaneous Papers

10:51 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Steven Johnson.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Johnson - ready to proceed to sentencing.  Atty Johnson has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with one correction, and no additions or deletions.  Statement by the Court.  Court has received the alternative PSI.  Court will allow the request for a new PSI if so requested.  Statement by Atty Johnson - requests the Court consider the alternative PSI as the correct one.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with one correction, and no additions or deletions.  Atty Johnson has received a copy of the alternative PSI - with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the alternative PSI - with no corrections, additions or deletions.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.

Sentencing argument by DA Christenson.  Sentencing argument by Atty Johnson.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2016CF34
 
Ct 1-18 months of Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision
Ct 3-18 months of Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision, concurrent to the other sentence.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (Each Count 1 & 3):

-Costs.  Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-AODA assessment.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.


2016CF45

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years, consecutive to the prison sentence.

CONDITIONS:

-Costs.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-AODA assessment.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court grants the defendant 184 days of sentence credit.  Sentence is to commence immediately.

Court finds the defendant eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.

Court orders the cash bond on file be applied to the court costs.

Court adjourned at 11:19 a.m.
Note:  Copy given to defense counsel and copy given to DA's office by person that filed the PSI.
for Continuance (Defendant's) - Original
Defendant's Motion for Continuance (Fax Copy)
Sentencing hearing on November 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.
to counsel with a copy of the presentence investigation report
to Agent Nichole Marshall - Court has approved the one week extension to file the PSI.  The PSI is due on August 22, 2016.
from Agent Nicole Marshall requesting a one week extension to file the PSI
State's
Sentencing hearing on September 13, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

1:26 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Steven Johnson.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Johnson recites agreement - defendant will plea to 16CF34 (Ct 1) and (Ct 3), balance of the counts will be DRI, defendant will plea to count 2 on 2016CF45 and counts 1 & 3 will be dismissed and read-in and 16CM25 will be dismissed and read-in, with a request for PSI.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 3 as charged on 2016CF34 and count 2 as charged on 2016CF45.  Court orders counts 2 & 4 on 2016CF34 and counts 1 & 3 on 2016CF45 and 2016CM25 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a presentence investigation be completed and filed with the court in approx 60 days.  Court sets for Sentencing on September 13, 2016 at 1:15 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:38 p.m.

1:40 p.m. Same appearances.  Statement by Atty Johnson in regards to bond.  Statement by DA.  Court denies the request for bond modification.

Court adjourned at 1:40 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 14, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

10:27 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Steven Johnson.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Johnson - defendant will waive the preliminary hearings on both felony cases.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial in each case.

State files the informations with the court.  Attorney Johnson and defendant acknowledge receipt of the informations and waives any reading.  Atty Johnson enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Atty Johnson reqeusts to be heard on bond and request a reduction of bond on 2016CF65.  Statement by DA Christenson.  Statement by the Court - denies the request for modification.  Court sets all cases for Plea & Sentencing on June 14, 2016 at 1:00 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 10:33 a.m.
By Atty Steven Johnson
Status hearing on May 24, 2016 at 10:30 am.

10:12 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Steven Johnson.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Initial on 2 felonies and status on misdemeanor.  Atty Johnson confirms receipt of the criminal complaints (2016CF45 & 2016CF34) and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count/case.  Court finds probable cause.  Court notes bond has been set on both cases.  Atty Johnson requests a signature bond on 2016CF45.  Court denies the defendant's request for modification.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set all cases for Status Hearing on May 24, 2016 at 10:30 a.m..

Court adjourned at 10:16 a.m.
Original Warrant has been received and destroyed
Initial appearance on May 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.

2:10 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  2016CF34 - Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and requests the Court read it to him. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Court notes bond has been set.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Court notes the defendant has requested an attorney.  Court finds good case to extend the limits of the preliminary hearing.  Court adjourns for Initial Appearance for attorney to be present.  Court sets both cases - 2016CF34 for Initial Appearance and 2016CM25 Status Hearing on May 10, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.
 
Court adjourned at 2:17 a.m.
